author: Travis
title: CRITQ~Art Criticism NFT Marketplace
description: Artists and buyers have difficulty finding the proper valuation of art and NFTs. Marketplaces need to integrate the process of art criticism

assessments.note: Alone the term "crowd sourced art criticism" is great. Decentralizing the area of art-criticism with a blockchain sounds like a marriage, made in heaven.

If measured against the metrics of the challenge:

"Did our efforts manage to attract users to the platform? It probably would attract artists but the cardano platform would be investable to them and as such wold not be users.

"Did our efforts result in new, viable applications built on top of Cardano?
Yes.


Usage of applications developed during the challenge:

* Number/growth of application output - small
* Number/growth of application transactions - small
* Total volume of Ada involved in application transactions - small
* Total/growth of resource usage by applications - slowly growing
* Number/growth of distinct addresses mentioned in application transactions - small
* If the application uses tokens:
* Number/growth of application tokens - small
* Number/growth of distinct addresses holding application tokens - small

This proposal, if implemented successfully will not bring developers other than itself to the Cardano platform

Although the proposal is not directly for a DApp, it does address a major integration for the Cardano blockchain - by supporting the trade and swap of art-related NFTs. I think that this proposal - if realized - would manage to attract users to the platform and would result in new, viable applications built on top of Cardano.
Creativity looks easy, but that's a carefully staged illusion—artists invest more effort than we often give them credit for
NFTs are the flavor of the season. competition in NFT markets dapp is required to create the best NFTplatform on cardano ecosystem.
I base my score mainly on the description in the proposal. The proposer checked competitors and described the solution in great detail. I feel, like they know what they need to do and how to do it.

The project principals certainly know the art world. And preumably can engage developers to build the app. Will they be able to attract known artists? or will they remain essentially the same as a local gallery. Perhaps if they were able to attract some :names" from the art world they would seem to have a greater chance of attracting critical mass of artists. Unless their aim is just to serve the artists who have no reputation, yet.

It is an ambitious, multi-faceted and plan for action in a newly-developing blockchain related field. The proposers have a very well balanced set of competencies and expertise that could lead to successful realization. The plan is broken down into phases and seems feasible with the human resources proposed.

team seems to be well balanced and already done some work in past which makes me believe that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.

I base my score mainly on the description in the proposal. There are three phases described for the realisation of the project and the positions in the phases are reasonable. They also state, that they might wait for some tooling to make aspects of the project easier. This gives me trust, that they concentrate on the essential parts.
The proposers seem to know their business and therefore can be expected to do what they say they will do. How much of an impact it will have is uncertain.
I agree that there is sufficient information on the proposal's feasibility and how effectively it addresses the challenge.
hope to art show ,more art related content ,more reliance partnership

the team has provided all the relative  information to assess that this project is feasible, but however I must  say that only problem it will face is from already existent proposals in the ecosystem which will compete with this team for the market access and market share.

solution: An NFT Art marketplace centred around crowdsourced art criticism rather than exclusive juried submissions or nonsensical bidding 'wars'
experience:
Travis Cook: Front-end dev, Art Gallery co-founder
Edno Mesquita: Fullstack, Blockchain Dev
David Fatimehin: Business, Gallery co-founder
